cohort.bio:
Header

Paragraph Quick bio.

Paragraph Quick bio.

Some of the techs in which I have become advanced: JavaScript, C#, SQL, Angular and Firebase.

Header

After working several years in the international education industry, I had the itch to learn something new and add to my softer skills. While working at Bridge Education Group in Denver, I had the opportunity to work with an amazing graphic design and web development team. I was amazed at what they were able to create (both in beautiful design and impressive functionality). If I asked them to move a button, they could! It was magic and I wanted to learn more about what they did each day. To try my hand at coding, I attended Nashville Software School's 3 week Jumpstart evening course - it was this course that helped me realize that not only could I learn software development, but I enjoyed it, as well! I am currently attending Nashville Software School's 6 month day program to learn both client side and server side development. I graduate at the end of March and am excited to see where this new career path takes me as I continually learn more about software development.

Header

During my time as a teacher I was surrounded by people who were eager to learn. I was inspired to pursue learning software development when our school district had a coding initiative that taught students and teachers the basics of coding. Once I finished the few rudimentary exercises they had for us, I was hooked. I ate up everything related to software and web development. So much so that I decided to make a career change to become a software developer.

I chose to go to Nashville Software School because of their strong track record of success and the 6 month time table was ideal for my situation. During my time at NSS I have had the opportunity to develop software in several languages such as: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS, C#, .NET, and SQL. I am on track to graduate from NSS on March 23, 2018. I am looking for a junior software development job in the Nashville area. I have a passion for software development and a love of learning. I am a driven individual who doesn’t give up until the job is done.

Header

Paragraph Quick bio.

Paragraph Quick bio.

Some of the techs in which I have become advanced: JavaScript, C#, SQL, Angular and Firebase.

cohort.reelThemIn: My love for all things computer extends back to the Packard Bell days. I've built them, broke them, and codedon them ever since.
cohort.bio:
Header

I am John Dulaney, a Software Developer and Tennessee Native. My love for computers extends back to installing programs with multiple floppy disks on my family's Packard Bell when I was 6. I've had a knack for computers ever since and have made it my career. After an extend stay at Wentworth Military Academy, I commissioned as an Infantry officer in the Missouri National Guard. Fastfoward to a 4 months later, a car wreck ended my Army career. The choice was obvious! I needed to get back to my love for computers. To start, I atttented Jumpstart at NSS. Enrolling in a 6 month C# program the second week because I knew it was for me. I graduate in late March and already I feel likeI have a world of coding at my fingertips. I cant wait to see what I learn during my next step forward.

Header

Paragraph Quick bio.

Paragraph Quick bio.

Some of the techs in which I have become advanced: JavaScript, C#, SQL, Angular and Firebase.

cohort.reelThemIn: Somewhere, someone will use what we design. That means we can make that person’s day that much better. That’s motivation!
cohort.bio:
Header

For the better part of a decade, I’ve worked with some of the best people in Nashville to identify, analyze, plan, and implement solutions to public safety issues. Now, as a developer, I get to continue those steps in a broader scope of solution needs. I love to learn and pass on learning, and I consider my workday satisfying when I’ve contributed value toward solutions and to my teammates’ quality of work-life.

Header

Header

Paragraph Quick bio.

Paragraph Quick bio.

Some of the techs in which I have become advanced: JavaScript, C#, SQL, Angular and Firebase.

Header

I’ve always loved blending creativity with technology and as an Audio Engineer, found great fulfillment in creating a new tangible representation of a musical performance. I love helping others and get excited when it involves learning something new. Technology has always fascinated me since receiving my first computer as a young child. Always curious how things worked, I would endlessly tinker, experiment and read about computers, electric bass gear, or music recording equipment. I built my first website as a college freshman and was immediately enamored with the power and possibilities. Almost every job I’ve held has been related to technology. As I pondered the next steps in my career, the Nashville Software School became the obvious choice since it mirrored my drive to dive deep into learning new things. I’ve loved the collaborative environment and being challenged every day.

The music recording industry drew me to Nashville and was my livelihood for over 15 years. Working my way up from studio intern to staff engineer and eventually freelance audio engineer instilled a great work ethic, perseverance, and attention to detail. Working with countless production teams allowed me to hone my teamwork skills and learn to adapt to different environments and meet challenging deadlines. Being a part of the industry while it began embracing computers and digital storage further ingrained my deep love of technology and lifelong learning. There is always something new to learn. The amount of crossover between the recording industry and software development is amazing, from breaking down projects into small achievable blocks, to communicating well on a team, and thinking outside the box to solve problems.

When I’m not coding I love to mountain bike, discover new craft beer, tinker with Android development and spend time with my family.

Header

Paragraph Quick bio.

Some of the techs in which I have become advanced: JavaScript, C#, SQL, Angular and Firebase.

Header

Paragraph Quick bio.

Paragraph Quick bio.

Header

I got my first taste of software developement during my previous carrer in the Automotive Manufacturing industry. Process development and improvement lead me down the path of leveraging many "No Code" solutions such as Microsoft Sharepoint and Infopath to automate buisiness processes. As powerful as those tools were, I constantly found myself asking our in-house development team for help in accomplishing things that were beyond the limits of those tools. Frustrated with slow response and needing to get things done I started researching how to implement simple things in HTML and CSS, but always wanted to learn how to do more.When my husbands job relocated us to Nashville, I decided it was the perfect opportunity to try and learn how to code for real. Finding a place like NSS was a dream come true for me. When I'm not coding I generally spend my time split between my remaining passions. Reading / Watching Sci-Fi and Fantasy novels and movies. Dreaming about owning / driving unique and or exotic vehicles, or spending quality time with my husband and dog.

Header

cohort.reelThemIn: Combining my experience in nonprofit and knowledge of technology to help others
cohort.bio:
Header

For as long as I can remember, I have had a passion for helping people and for creating things. I’ve mostly kept these two passions separate: channeling my creative side into hobbies and my desire to help others into a career path.

After spending several years working in various positions at non-profits, I started to feel like keeping my passions divided was preventing me from finding an ideal fit in my professional life so I began to explore ways that I could combine them. Coding has always piqued my interest, so I took a few online classes and soon found myself leaving my non-profit job to enroll in the full-time Web Developer Bootcamp at Nashville Software School. I am fascinated with all of the things that technology can do and enjoy the ever changing landscape of the tech industry.

Since beginning my journey at Nashville Software school, I have learned how to turn ideas into code and am excited to continue to see how furthering my skills as a software developer will allow me to help others.

cohort.reelThemIn: Software Developer | Sound Designer | Sandwich Devotee
cohort.bio:
Header

I am a Sound Designer jumping head-first into the world of coding! After years of pursuing and studying audio production, I have switched my focus to software development, because of the opportunity for constantly learning and problem solving. In less than two months I will complete a 6 month full-time bootcamp studying Full-Stack development. Nashville Software School has shaped me to think like a software developer. Beyond that, the program has taught me how to work in a group environment and the importance of writing code that not only executes correctly, but is readable to others.

Header

My introduction into professional software development began with my enrollment here in Cohort 22 at Nashville Software School. A passion for creativity, an appreciation for critical thinking and problem solving, and a desire for a career that would push an inquiring mind to constantly pursue new knowledge, all led me to this path. The lessons learned and skills acquired during my apprenticeship with NSS confirm that I have arrived at the right place, and that as my drive to learn increases, so will my contribution to the craft.

cohort.reelThemIn: If you build it, it might run
cohort.bio:
Header

Originally in business management for specialty coffee, I always enjoyed incorporating new technologies to help automate day-day tasks. For anyone experienced in retail or café culture, there is no shortage of need to continuously streamline business operations. Through my experience running café's, I was approached by a friend to help build an eCommerce startup with the goal of importing Italian coffee equipment. I helped build the company's webstore in my free time at night while running the café by day utilizing user friendly technologies Squarespace and Shopify. That role ignited my interest in software development to learn and understand how these tools work under the hood and whether I could build some new tools myself. After some time self-studying through various online resources, I heard about Nashville Software School which offered a condensed, bootcamp-style software education teaching the primary skills in full-stack development, SCRUM methodology and the importance of continuous education. I attended a few info sessions to learn more about the school, signed up for a month long introduction to web development Jumpstart class, and quickly became hooked. I joined Evening Cohort E6 for front-end in June of 2017 and Day Cohort 22 in January of 2018 for back-end. Now I'm looking forward to joining a team in my first role as a Software Developer and furthering my software skillset.

Header

cohort.reelThemIn: nashville native - combat veteran - lifelong learner
cohort.bio:
Header

I am an Army Infantry Veteran who decided in early 2015 that I would harness my love of learning, technology, and solving problems by passionately pursuing a career in Software Development, at that time I had never seen a line of code. By August of 2015, I was out of the Army, enrolled in school as a Computer Programming student, and I remember vividly the elation and feeling of success I experienced after solving my first coding problem in my Intro to Object-Oriented Programming class. At that moment, I knew I had found my calling. When I'm not in school or sharpening my coding skills, you will find me spending time with family and friends, reading, listening to podcasts, enjoying live-music downtown, cheering on the Predators, Vols, and Titans, or dusting the camera off to shoot photos.
